Reviews.Title: A great upgrade from the CS50!
Reviews.Author: RST10
Reviews.Content: I've owned several Plantronics headsets over the years, and yes, the good ones are all expensive. That being said, they've been making great strides in improving comfort and functionality. This unit replaced a CS50 that I used for VOIP applications and plugged directly into a computer. This headset has many other features that the CS50 had, but I wanted to write a review specifically for those considering upgrading from a CS50. I use this particular model instead of Bluetooth or others because the range is exceptional-- almost as good as a cordless phone, and in some cases better! Far more than Bluetooth could ever think of with today's current standards.What makes this unit better than the CS50? A few things:1. Lighter/smaller2. Replaceable tips and ear holders so you can customize the fit for your head. Really helps for those multiple hour calls.3. You can use a USB dongle to plug in to the PC instead of having to plug the dock in via USB like the CS50-- better for travel & mobile use.4. The unit will charge via USB dock if you don't have a power adapter with you-- much more mobile than the CS50.5. The ear piece is smaller and fits in the ear with a gel instead of a "one size fits most" on the CS50.6. The ear tip actually SWIVELS forward & backward-- maybe the single most innovative part of this unit compared to CS50. No work, it just adjusts to fit you properly!7. Far more mobile-friendly. Comes with a hard shell carrying case so you can take just the USB adapter, the headset, and USB charging cable.8. The audio quality is excellent, and has a little better user feedback than CS50 so you can tell if your mic is open or not.9. Battery is far more easily replaceable, though I've never had to replace a battery in the past.10. Also works great with MAC without any additional install of software. OS X current supports it automatically. I primarily use it with Windows 7.I couldn't be more pleased with this device as an upgrade to the CS50. It sounds good on both ends, and I can also say that it works well with Google Voice, Skype, and other "not corporate" VOIP solutions as well. As we travel, we have business and personal life that doesn't stop and this device helps connect you to both seamlessly.I know they're pricey-- but if you're a true professional or demanding of a great headset or talk lots of hours or frequently, you will be very pleased with this device.

Reviews.Title: Great soft phone for wireless talk
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl
Reviews.Content: I've tried a number of wireless headsets for soft phones.  I work from home about 60% of the time, and spend most of my day on conference calls with people in other locations.  I had a Plantronics C50 headset, but this is a great upgrade.Plusses:1. It is wireless both from the USB base, and the USB base plugs directly into the computer without a wire.  The C50/60 version had a charging base that was wired to the USB port and wired to the power.  THis one is wired only to the power (which doesn't have to be connected to the computer) and the USB connection is a small toggle that plugs into the USB port.  Now I don't have to have messy wires on my desk (I can keep the charger somewhere else where it isn't in the way).2. The unit itself isn't that large compared to most softphone headsets.  It has three options for wearing:  over the head, around the back of the neck, or over the ear.  This is extremely versatile and gives you the options to fit it to your personal preference.  Others I've seen only have two options.3. The quality is good. I can walk all over my house - upstairs and downstairs without interruption.4. The buttons are easy to use.  On the C50/60 version, the mute wasn't as easy to find and I ended up cutting off my calls a few times before I got the hang of it.  THis one is really easy to use.5. The wearing styles are all lightweight and comfortable.  The last Jabra I tried (and returned within one day) would never fit over my ear (this one has three different ear pieces), and the over the head piece wasn't adjustable and was too big for my head.Minus:1. Expensive2. None of the wireless headsets have as good a quality as the wired ones, so a very small minus there, but read: VERY small.3. It's bigger than the ear pieces you use with your mobile phone.  If you want something that small, recognize that your bluetooth quality with a softphone app is never as good as the USB wireless.  There's just too much interference.  However, as designed-for-softphone headsets go, this one has a small profile and is lightweight.Overall I give this 5 stars.  It is without a doubt the best I've used, and I've tried them all: USB/Bluetooth, bluetooth, wired, over the ear, over the head, behind the head.  I've had three logitech models (all wired), two Jabra models (both wireless), multiple bluetooth ear pieces that also work with my iPhone, and three plantronics.  The plantronics are the best, and this is the best of the best.For people who spend a lot of time on the phone, this is great.Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: USB CS50 replacement
Reviews.Author: Rob White
Reviews.Content: The Plantronics USB W440 wireless headset is supposed to be the replacement for the USB CS50 laptop headset.  My company used and sold the USB CS50 for the last 6 years with our home inspection software.  The CS50 had a range of 200 feet, depending on the home and a battery life of about 6 hours.  In testing the W440 replacement, we found the range no where near 300 feet from inside the home, more like 50 feet and the battery only last about 3 1/2 hours instead of the 7 hours advertised.  It was recommended to use an USB extender cable to locate the USB dongle away from the laptop as that could interfere with the transmission (why create a USB dongle that plugs into a laptop if it can interfere).  I am really disappointed that Plantronics has created a product that is not better than the product they are replacing.

Reviews.Title: Great for pacing and dictating.
Reviews.Author: Jonathan White
Reviews.Content: Great. Works well with Dragon Dictate.It needs the USB because it runs on something that works better than bluetooth, so don't get confused and think you can use it with your phone or ipad. You can't. But if you want to pace your office, look out the window, and write long chunks of text at the same time, my research said it was among the best on the market and it's been working exceptionally well-- better than medium-quality wired mics I was using before.

Reviews.Title: Plantronics W440 SAVI
Reviews.Author: W. Beauregard
Reviews.Content: It just works. Brilliant. I'm using it with Dragon Dictate 12 to write this comment.  It's comfortable: it includes 4 earpiece customizations to better fit your ear and 3 wearing options. Shipping was as expected.

Reviews.Title: Great and easy
Reviews.Author: RAFAEL BENOLIEL
Reviews.Content: This is a great piece of equipment. Works well and easy to set up. I use it for Dragon dictate software for the Mac and it is a great pair up. The service was great too.

Reviews.Title: Wish it had better range
Reviews.Author: J. M. Cavalieri "mrcavalieri"
Reviews.Content: It probably has about 75-100 ft range before it starts cutting in and out.  I would love another 200 feet, but for the money, it is what it is.

Reviews.Title: Using Skype exclusively as my business phone.
Reviews.Author: Richard P Mithoff
Reviews.Content: Within 5 minutes out of the box I was using the W440 without issues.  The quick setup is several easy to follow steps.  Be sure you download the Spokes software from Plantronics to allow seamless call answering from Skype.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with the quality. Wish it cost less, but I'm a happy customer.
Reviews.Author: Scuba Junkie
Reviews.Content: Installation was super easy, the headset is comfortable, and most important is that the calls are clear.  I appreciated how you can wear the band over or behind your head or around your ear.  I wear mine with the band over the head, and I can hear just fine.  No one can tell when I am walking around the room in a teleconference using Mobile Office Communicator on a Windows laptop.

Reviews.Title: Super!!
Reviews.Author: A. Niblett "Vernie"
Reviews.Content: I needed a headset that would allow me the freedom to move about my house if necessary.  I have a 2 story, 2800sq ft home.  My office is in the lower NE corner and I was able to stay connected to a phone call no matter where I was in the house.  I went to every corner up and down stairs.  I would recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Great clarity, range and easy to install
Reviews.Author: Gene Spillane
Reviews.Content: I work from home and my office is in the basement so I needed something that would allow me to walk around.I can walk upstairs while on a call and basically roam the entire upstairs without issue accept for the very back of the house.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: zen
Reviews.Content: i am disappointed in this product.  It worked very well, but the battery runs out much too quickly.  I bought an extra battery because it said that it was hot swappable.  Both still run out of the charge before the work day is over.  I find myself going back to the wired headphones.

Reviews.Title: Great for softphones!
Reviews.Author: Don Bell
Reviews.Content: Have had this product for about a month.  The reception quality on this device is much better than the bluetooth adapter headset which we had been using previously (also a plantronics device).  My customers can hear me without distortion and vice versa. Additionally, we have been using devices in the W400 series in the office for a few months now and have had virtually zero problems.

Reviews.Title: Great Hands Free Headset to Replace My CS50 USB Headset
Reviews.Author: RJGoodhouse
Reviews.Content: I actually really do like the headset, it is working better than the Model CS50 that I used for years. I recently reported having Battery Re-Charging Issues and the Rushed a Replacement headset out to me so I didn't miss being able to use a Headset for my Tech Support work, Being hands free while I'm supporting folks over the phone and remotely is very Important to my Customers. I gladly recommend this headset to anyone looking for a hands free USB talking. This Headset is so clear that folks don't realize you are talking on a headset or a computer. I love the freedom I get with this headset. I also enjoy being able to Hot_swap the Battery when the Battery gets low. You Just need to Mute the phone which puts the called on hold, swap the battery with a Fresh Battery, then Un-Mute the phone and you are back to talking to your customer again. changing the battery has never been so easy.

Reviews.Title: Your cell phone can only dream of sounding this good
Reviews.Author: Colin
Reviews.Content: I have tried bluetooth headsets in the past, of varying qualities and price-points, but I have always been disappointed with them. The narrowband bluetooth audio codec leaves me struggling to hear and be heard, and the ones I've tested seem to add a vexing amount of delay.Enter the Savi, which uses DECT instead of bluetooth, and that makes a world of difference. Now, instead of being chained to my desk with a wired microphone or a short-ranged headset, I can get up and walk around anywhere in my house. The battery lasts me about six hours of continuous use.But it's not just about range and talk time: usability also matters. I find the Savi quite comfortable wear for its entire battery life, although the single-ear wear option doesn't feel particularly secure. The headset has noise cancellation that works well in rooms with air conditioners and fans that are loud enough to wreak havoc with my laptop's internal microphone. I even got in my car and drove it maybe ten feet before the called party noticed---and that's only because I lost my connection.All of this means that I am free to wander around and do things when I'm on the phone---without worrying that I'm transmitting a ton of noise. This makes holding long conversations a lot more convenient and natural. If you pair it with a high-quality, 1080p webcam, it's the next-best thing to actually being there.In terms of downsides, the mute button is a little hard to press in, and the hardware up/down buttons don't seem to change the volume a whole lot. You can adjust the volume more on your computer, just like any other audio device. The audio is on par with a very good landline telephone connection, which makes sense given its DECT innards. Still, if you're looking to listen to music or movies, you're probably better off buying a device that is designed for that purpose. The headset is fully linux-compatible, although on Ubuntu 13.04 it is necessary to add some lines to your xorg.conf file to get it to work correctly.I don't know how the Savi compares against other high-end wireless headsets, but it has absolutely been worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Pretty solid device
Reviews.Author: AZ Lion "AZ Lion"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up.  Charge lasts quite a while but you have to charge between calls if you have a heavy call volume.  The only disappointment is that it's range is not as good as advertised.  If I'm in the immediate room or within 25 feet its good but beyond that its questionable. Even so it is so much better than being tethered to the computer.  Sound quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Works great AWESOME range!!!!
Reviews.Author: matthew
Reviews.Content: Works awesome with my avaya softphone and the range is INCREDIBLE. I can easily get 100+ yards of range without dropping or static. Battery is alright, lasts long enough.

Reviews.Title: love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Michael F.
Reviews.Content: I only use this thing for my PC when I am playing games online and I connect to a mumble, team speak, skype or vent server.  Thats it so I cannot comment on the other features.  However for what I am using it for it easily connects with a push of a button and it sounds fantastic and people can hear me loud and clear.  Much better then Bluetooth.  I am able to walk around my house with it on and it doesn't lose connection. After a few hours it does start to hurt my ear a little so I will play with the other ear attachments and see if I can find a better fit.  Just remember to always put this back on the charger when you are done with it.

Reviews.Title: Just. Wow.
Reviews.Author: Jason N. Weddington "JW"
Reviews.Content: Comes with a "fit kit" with lots of options for making it work for your head / ears. I use the over-the-head attachment. I can wear it thing all day without my ears hurting, and the range allows me to wander around the house on long calls.The Plantronics software causes issues with GoToMeeting on MacOS X 10.9 (Mavericks) but the device works fine without the software installed.

Reviews.Title: Did not last long...
Reviews.Author: E Camp ND
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item and it worked fairly well. The folks I talked to said it cut out frequently but the biggest issue I had with this product is that it broke within 5 months at the point where the transmitter bends. It was not put to hard use, but was frequently plugges in and then removed. I would not repurchase it and am looking for a different solution.

Reviews.Title: My office softphone option
Reviews.Author: Bob Jones
Reviews.Content: These headsets were recommended for use as our Softphone option.  They have a few issues here and there, but it seems like Plantronics is usually aware of the issue and gets it fixed in the next patch or 2.  Very light weight.  Multiple options on how to wear it.  I almost forget I am wearing it!If you are looking for a good headset option for a phone, skype, or something of that nature, this is the headset you want.  Very clear quality, stylish, and light!

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: leuwers
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, I have xlite as voip and skype it works perfectly on both of them.I pluged in and it works nothing more to do. Sounds is great as well as coverage.I work from home + travels this product meets my needs in both situations.I was a little bit reluctant to purchase due to the price but I have no regret.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm!!
Reviews.Author: Kelly Musarra "2katz"
Reviews.Content: I have tried many, many units and finally - one that it actually comfortable, fits my ear (I have a small ear) and doesn't give me a headache!I had absolutely no problem running it on my computer, just plug-n-play.  Our office will be losing our desk phones within the next few months, so we'll see how it works with everyone wireless!

Reviews.Title: Original unit did not work properly - headset call button would not pickup incoming call; but replacement unit did
Reviews.Author: Eddie Martin
Reviews.Content: Amazon - ***** !!I received a replacement unit on Dec 24 after submitting replacement request late Dec 21.  Plugged in the new unit and it worked immediately without any other software setup that was left over from the defective unit.Original unit did not work correctly with CISCO IP Communicator - the headset call button would not pickup incoming call nor normal calling process with CISCO IP Communicator.  Spent 1.5hours with Plantronics over the phone without success.Did to troubleshoot: de-installed and re-installed the Plantronics Spokes and Enterprise CISCO IP Communicator with the same results.  Plantronics Technical Support suggested that the unit maybe defective.If you buy the product from Amazon, deal with return to Amazon.  Plantronics will send you warranty replacement but you own the  defective unit shipping cost to Plantronics.

Reviews.Title: The core features are superb
Reviews.Author: Steve Cichosz "Steve"
Reviews.Content: The headset itself is absolutely excellent! I would have given it a 5 star rating and even maybe gone 6 stars in the text here if not for the advertised integration with Skype being so poor. If they were to stop advertising this integration as a feature then every aspect of the device would flawlessly earn a 5 star rating.I spend about half my day on the phone in meetings. After each call I simply put the headset in the cradle, it puts itself in the correct mode automatically and charges itself. I have been on calls of several hours in a row and never had any sign the battery was getting weak.The range of the device is nothing short of superb.  With my old headset I could have taped a line on the floors of the house for where it would cut out. I couldn't get to the kitchen to make tea during a call. I also pace quite a bit when in a meeting and being on a call with my previous headset was like being leashed to my desk. I'd have to stop going in a particular direction within about 10 feet in mid stride as if the leash had gone taught. With this headset I can even go out and check the mail while on a call for crying out loud! (This actually saved my behind when I agreed to take a letter to the mailbox for my wife and saw it setting on my desk when the mailman was at our mailbox. I grabbed the letter and ran to the box expecting to be dropped from the call, but instead heard every syllable spoken.) I have walked to every corner of our "largish" house with no loss of clarity. This means I can go on mute and maybe play a game of pool during those really boring company status updates.  ;^)The advertised Skype interface simply didn't work out of the box. The software was easy enough to download once I was able to locate it, but failed to work after being installed.  The first call to support had me updating the device firmware. I only run OS X and Linux systems in our house and unfortunately the firmware can only be upgraded through the Windows OS, so I had to come up with a Windows system to do the update. That was more than a little irritating. The firmware update did do the trick and got me connected. Unfortunately connecting is only a portion of what is needed to have a successful phone call. One needs to be able to answer incoming calls and hang up the phone when the call is completed. I'll not go into the gory deals of the hoops I had to jump through in order to accomplish these fundamental tasks, but suffice to say the interface for the headset buttons to operate Skype was severely compromised. After several more calls to an exceptionally helpful support desk we determined that the software simply won't work on my version of OS X which is not even close to being considered unsupported by Apple. I started refusing to continue updating OS X when Apple started forcing the incorporation of facebook software on the end user in their OS. Nobody I know actually trusts that company whether they use the service or not, so why Apple would incorporate the software of such an untrusted entity in their most important software product I have no idea. Anyway, I bring this up only to make the point that there are legitimate reasons for my not upgrading OS X and being left without the Skype support for the headset.The numerous options for the earpiece assure that the headset is a comfortable fit for about any human being, and probably even most primates should they find their self needing to take a call. I use the "over the ear" approach myself and find it very comfortable.All in all, the core functionality of the device is excellent, the battery life is excellent and the customer support is excellent. If Plantronics were to stop advertising the sketchy Skype support as a phone feature that drags it down and make it an optional add-on, they would certainly have just about a flawless device offering.

Reviews.Title: Works for both Mac & PC.
Reviews.Author: P. Farmer
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and doesn't take much room on the desk. I like easy things. Have it working on both my MacBook Air and PC. Absolutely no issues. Nothing to install. Just plugged it in and and it worked.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't have the same range as my C50, not all Skype functions work
Reviews.Author: Illen
Reviews.Content: PRO:Headset is lighter than C50CON:More portable than C50The range is about 10m less (32 feet for you simpletons) than the C50,slightly lower call quality (occasional audio issues).When playing messages in Skype the earpiece doesn't turn on automatically and i have to press the button manually.I purchased this to REPLACE my C50 which was perfectly fine (the only issue with C50 is it was not easy to travel with), turns out to be a disappointment since the range is reduced.  This surprised me since a newer version surely should be better than the old.  Not always the case unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: sucks
Reviews.Author: Jamie A.
Reviews.Content: not happy with this model at all. I upgraded from a older model and that one was so comfortable. this one has a plastic ear piece that is not durable or comfortable. It is also so annoying to have to press the button every time someone calls instead of just auto picking up. Also the mute button is so inconvenient. Hate it and its too late to return. This cost way to much for what you get

Reviews.Title: good headset
Reviews.Author: Short One
Reviews.Content: Provides clear connections. comfortable to wear for extended periods of time. Good range. If used in a noisy environment, can pick up a lot of background sounds.

Reviews.Title: Works with Polycom VVX 500 via direct USB!
Reviews.Author: Brian Flores
Reviews.Content: Google searched everywhere to see if the Plantronics Savi W440 or any of the Plantronics DECT USB sticks would work with a Polycom VVX phone.  I found nothing.  So we ordered a W440 and tried.  It worked like a champ!!!  Call quality is good. And you can answer and hang up by pressing the button on the headset.  You can walk around, by outside your office (and not hear your desk phone ring).. Because the headset makes a small ringtone in your ear, to let you know the VVX phone is rigining.  You tap the button on your W440 ear piece and bam! You are talking.  When you are done..tap again, and the call hangs up. Only downside.. The ear piece is so clear, that when you hit the button to hang up.. You don't know if you hung up or not.  I wish they had some audible tone, or voice prompt that says "call ended" or something. Minor con.  Also want to note that we tested the Plantronics B300 Bluetooth USB adapters, and they also worked like a champ with the Polycom VVX 500 phones.  We prefer the further distance with the DECT technology in the Savi W series.  We got about 100ft max before it stated to break up.  But we had to outside with signal through our cement brick walls, and are surprised we even got 100ft.  We can take boxes to the dumpster outside, and still be on calls?  I'm sold!  W440's for everyone!  Next review... Testing with multiple w440's in the office.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Great wireless headset.  I can walk around my house and take out the trash without losing the signal
Reviews.Author: Richard Brockhoff
Reviews.Content: I work from home and spend about 4 to 5 hours a day on calls.  This headset is very lightweight and dependable.  The sound from the headset is great and others tell me the clarity when I speak is great.  If your are looking for a lightweight headset that can be used day after day this is a great choice.  4 of my co-workers also use this headset and no one has run into any issues

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Root
Reviews.Content: Great product, I highly recomend if you are looking for a VOIP to function through your computer.  I use it w/ Google talk and it is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Best headset system
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Best headset system!  Very happy with this produc, use it for work every day at home and can walk from room to room with losing reception.

Reviews.Title: Good but not "tough."
Reviews.Author: Trooper Keenan Mulvaney
Reviews.Content: I use this in a law enforcement setting. Be very careful about connecting the USB Bluetooth receiver directly to your laptop. It is not "tough." Anyway, great product otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Great headset
Reviews.Author: Amy K Villalon
Reviews.Content: Headset works well, battery life is good and functions well.  I would recommend this headset, I currently use it for work for our Cisco IP communicator and it works well.

Reviews.Title: Great sound - Works well
Reviews.Author: Jay Vander Wall
Reviews.Content: The sound quality is great.  It works well with my Cisco Jabber softphone.  The product has a lot of headset configuration options so it was easy to get a good fit.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I have never had a wireless headset before.  But I had very specific requirement.....it needed to be reliable, stay on my head comfortably, I needed to be able to hear clearly, be heard clearly and to adjust volume, mute or end call from the headset.  It does all those things.  I use it for work because I have a VOIP phone which allows me to travel/work remotely.  This device was easy to set-up and easy to use.  It has made my life easier.

Reviews.Title: Makes my work day BETTER
Reviews.Author: MLArnold
Reviews.Content: Love the product; I run a software company and it makes life and travel wonderful. Crystal clear on VOIP and GoToMeeting.

Reviews.Title: Looks great, works alright
Reviews.Author: Kyle Humphrey
Reviews.Content: Use this for work. If you are looking for a cheaper alternative to buying the land line based version of this headset just realize that it’s cheaper and the USB signal and quality is less. If the price outweighs the performance go for it. The range isn't quite as far as it is marketed (at least in my case and environment) but it works well and looks great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: jamie walker
Reviews.Content: Very nice easy to install sound is great extra battery life is wonderful. Only con is when you click to answer pause a second and let the Bluetooth kick in before you speak.

Reviews.Title: Finally. Comfort. Quality. Value, and Style
Reviews.Author: pureodb
Reviews.Content: This thing just works.  Fast recharge. Good battery life.  Great design.  Winner! I would highly recommend this for anyone that use VOIP regularly.  Also has excellent noise cancellation.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had needed to keep it.
Reviews.Author: Virjeanne Cornwell
Reviews.Content: I had ordered this based on a new job that I had taken.  The job fell through, so there was no need for the product.  It had everything one could ever need for a headset and the packaging was superb.  If I ever actually do have a need for a headset in the future, this will definitely be the one I would purchase.

Reviews.Title: Plantronics W440 (D100) Head set
Reviews.Author: Rock Chalk "Go Jayhawks!"
Reviews.Content: Just flat didn't work.  Head set did not connect to the USB .  It was a gift item and we were really disappointed.  Spent over an hour on the phone with tec support and still didn't work.  At my own cost I sent it back.  Haven't heard anything.  Would I recommend this?  Heck no.

Reviews.Title: Plantronics W440 wireless headset
Reviews.Author: Joan J. Shay
Reviews.Content: It's bulky, and doesn't sync with all phones. I wouldn't buy another one, and if others ask, I will not recommend.

ProductInfo.Features:
Lightest DECT wireless convertible headset with noise cancelling mic to filter out background noise
Multitask handsfree up to 300 feet from base
Hot swappable battery for unlimited talk time
One-touch call answer/end volume +/- mute and flash with supported softphones
Voice dedicated DECT technology eliminates W-Fi interference
ProductInfo.Name: Plantronics SAVI W440 Convertible, Wireless DECT Headset System for Laptop, Softphone & Multimedia Use - Black & Silver
